qas.question: What Umayyad ruler is regarded as especially just and pious by Sunni scholars?
For whom did Umar end the jizya?
In what year did Umar ibn Ad Al-Aziz die?
What was Umar ibn Ad al-Aziz's cause of death?
What group did Umar ibn Ad Al-Aziz grant liberties to?
What Umayyad ruler is hated by Sunni sources?
When was Umar ibn Abd al-Aziz born?
What happened when later governments tried to continue Umar ibn Abd al-Aziz's tax policies?
What unanimously praised most of the Umayyad rulers?

context: Only Umayyad ruler (Caliphs of Damascus), <a0_0><b5_0><b9_0>Umar ibn Abd al-Aziz<b9_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>, is unanimously praised by <b8_0>Sunni sources<b8_0/> for his devout piety and justice. In his efforts to spread Islam he established liberties for the <a4_0>Mawali<a4_0/> by abolishing the jizya tax for <a1_0>converts to Islam<a1_0/>. Imam Abu Muhammad Adbullah ibn Abdul Hakam stated that Umar ibn Abd al-Aziz also stopped the personal allowance offered to his relatives stating that he could only give them an allowance if he gave an allowance to everyone else in the empire. Umar ibn Abd al-Aziz was later <a3_0>poisoned<a3_0/> in the year <a2_0><b6_0>720<b6_0/><a2_0/>. When successive governments tried to reverse Umar ibn Abd al-Aziz's tax policies <b7_0>it created rebellion<b7_0/>.
